item.title: Hollywood Glam
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: A quick trip to Hollywood to interview the cast of the new movie, â€œBad Times At The El Royaleâ€ and #WhenInRome, a fashionista has...
item.content:encoded:
What:
A quick trip to Hollywood to interview the cast of the new movie, â€œBad Times At The El Royaleâ€ and #WhenInRome, a fashionista has to get glammed up to go sightseeing, shopping and spend time at the first place to ever host the Academy Awards. #AndTheOscarGoesToâ€¦..

Why:
I havenâ€™t been to my old stomping grounds, a.k.a Hollywood, in four years. After getting promoted to Co-host of Deco Drive, my #JetSetLife came to a well-deserved end. l hate to admit it, but after zigzagging the globe for almost two decades, I had grown tired of life on the road and was ready for a new challenge. Of course, that doesnâ€™t mean I donâ€™t miss interviewing the wordâ€™s biggest stars in fabulous far away places. I actually do â€” sometimes.

So, when my Assignment Editor, Odette, asked if I wanted to attend a press junket for â€œBad Times At The El Royaleâ€ in Los Angeles â€” I was game. Not only would I get to interview the cast of the movie, Iâ€™d get to do a fashion blog, too. #SignMeUp Sweetening the deal was a weekend stay at The Hollywood Roosevelt, which happens to be where the very first Academy Awards were held in 1929.

While LA hasnâ€™t changed much, movie making sure has, or at least the kind of movies Hollywood is generating nowadays. If itâ€™s not a superhero bonanza, itâ€™s a blanket comedy or a cheesy romcom, which makes â€œBad Times At The El Royaleâ€ all the better: itâ€™s original, unique & provocative. In fact, Iâ€™ve never seen anything like it in all my years as a movie critic. Set in the 60â€™sâ€¦

The story centers around 7 very different people who are drawn to a mysterious hotel called the EL Royale. As each character checks in, you learn their â€œsurfaceâ€ backstory and how, coincidentally, theyâ€™re all looking for some kind of redemption. You know, like righting a personal wrong. The beginning of the movie starts with lighthearted tongue-in-cheek banter, subtlety hinting at the craziness to come and boy, does it ever…

As night falls on the El Royale, a suspenseful thriller is born with more twists and turns than the Kingda Ka at Six Flags in Jersey. Btw, Kingda Ka is said to be one of the scariest roller coasters in the world. And all those surface backstories I mentioned boil over like a messy pot of overheated turkey chili (turkey chili happens to be my favorite. I eat it with extra cheese and sour cream) …

So, whatâ€™s the movie ultimately about? Donâ€™t think this is a cop-out, but itâ€™s a matter of personal interpretation. #GoodVersesEvil #Perspective #Perception #NothingIsAsItSeems #OldHotelsCreepMeOut speaking of, eventually the El Royale reveals itself as a house of indiscretion, filled with two-way mirrors, secret rooms and buried skeletons. And you, the audience, are the ones doing the spying alongside hotel â€œmanagement.â€ Meaning, you really get to see whatâ€™s going on in each character’s life.

The movie, which is the brainchild of writer/director Drew Goddard (best known for nail biting stories like â€œCabin in the Woods,â€ â€œWorld War Z,â€ and â€œThe Martian,â€) delivers more than just a hair-raising cinematic rideâ€¦ “Bad Times At The El Royale” is beautifully shot and edited and the ensemble cast is icing on the cake. Talk about acting chomps — while Chris Hemsworth is a stand-out and not just because he walks around the majority of the time with his shirt hanging off (okay, maybe that helps a little,) newcomer Cynthia Erivo is the #bombdotcom, too…

She delivers a breakout performance as Darlene Sweet, a down-on-her-luck singer. Although Cynthia is a theater veteran, this is her FIRST feature film role and WOW, if this performance is any indication of whatâ€™s to come, sheâ€™s headed for superstar status. Her on-screen presence is electric and her singing a revelation.

Iâ€™m not gonna lie, this film heads in a direction I didnâ€™t see coming, not by a long shot, which is kind of the point. Itâ€™s a bag of thought-provoking tricks mixed in with a little Quentin Tarantino meets Robert Rodriguez. If youâ€™re not big on violence, consider yourself warned. It gets really ugly, really fast. Iâ€™m not big on blood and guts, but support it if done in an artistic way that enriches the story and moves the plot forward and in this case, it does both alongside delivering a shocking ending. Want more?

Check out my interviews with the cast of the movie and see my full review atÂ DecoDrive.comÂ  ND enjoy the blog pictures of a day well spent strolling the Hollywood Walk of Fame and shopping on Rodeo Drive â€” because #Movies and #Memorable places (especially where I can buy a great pair of shoes,) will always be one my Favorite Things.

Where:
I interviewed the cast at www.thehollywoodroosevelt.com
Isnâ€™t the junket set cool?

When:
Bad Times At The El Royale opens in theaters October 12th

item.title: Suited Up
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: â€œSuiting Upâ€ for fall; inspired by the fabulous fashions featured in the new movie: â€œA Simple Favor.â€ Now, can someone pass me a martini?...
item.content:encoded:
What:

â€œSuiting Upâ€ for fall; inspired by the fabulous fashions featured in the new movie: â€œA Simple Favor.â€ Now, can someone pass me a martini?

Why:

I bought my first suit more than two decades ago at a strip mall outside of Albuquerque, New Mexico. God, I loved it. It was bright red with a sassy side tie (think the top half of a DVF dress) and in true 90â€™s style, it came with matching pants that featured a slightly flared leg. I felt like a million bucks in it and even though it was made out of a suffocating wool blend, I wore the crap out of it. It was proper and serious with just the right amount of pizzazz.

It was my go-to outfit for dozens of auditions before scoring my first big break hosting news cut-inâ€™s at a local television station in Amarillo, Texas â€” after that, it became a wardrobe staple. It gave me confidence and, in turn, I performed better â€” if you call white-knuckling it and hoping for the best when the tally light came on as â€œbetterâ€. Lol. I was so inexperienced, yet wearing that suit was a complete revelation: it was the first time I felt the power of fashion and how wearing something that I truly loved made me feel good about myself.Â 

Isnâ€™t it funny how a certain article of clothing can take you back in time and remind you of pivotal moments in your life? Years later, the thought of that red suit is still deeply rooted in the memories of my budding television career. Eventually, it wore out on me: reporting on brush fires, chasing storms and schlepping all over the High Plains of Texas did a number on it. It was torn, tattered and drenched in hard work; I wouldnâ€™t have had it any other way.

When the time came to give it away, I became silly & sentimental and instead, folded it like a military uniform and put it in a plastic bin with a handful of mothballs. I still remember the sound of the lid when I sealed it: â€œclick, click, clickâ€ and just like that, my sassy red suit was officially cataloged into the scrapbook of my life.

Since then, Iâ€™ve owned and worn A LOT of different suits and while the evolution of the garment has woven its way in and out of my wardrobe for years (especially as a broadcast journalist,) itâ€™s also taken its place in fashion history. And while being â€œSuited Upâ€ is always a good idea because the look is so versatile, its popularity has soared this fall even more, thanks to actress Blake Lively and her new movie: â€œA Simple Favor.â€

Blake plays Emily, a mysterious and chic fashion exec who suddenly goes missing. A stylish and suspenseful game of cat-and-mouse ensues as her best friend, played by Anna Kendrick, goes looking for her. Not only is it a great thriller, itâ€™s a film that manages to breathe new life into the already popular â€œSuited Upâ€ trend. In the movie, Blake is dripping in gorgeous jackets, vests, trousers, and two-toned loafers sure to make any fashionista drool with envy.

Believe it or not, the masculine-feminine costume choices were initially Blakeâ€™s idea, inspired by the film’s director, Paul Feig â€” whose style is nothing short of a walking magazine ad. Paul has an unprecedented fashion sense, especially for a manâ€¦think Bugsy Siegel meets Sherlock Holmes mixed in with a little bit of James Bond. #Dashing #Suave & #Handsome. When he heard Blakeâ€™s idea of taking his â€œSuited Upâ€ sensibility and translating it into her characterâ€™s on-screen wardrobe, he immediately gave it the green light.

Thatâ€™s where Costume Director, Renee Ehrlich Kalfus, comes in. Not only did she comb over couture designs by Helmet Newton and Chanel, she also made mood boards featuring classic photos of actresses like Marlene Dietrich and Lauren Bacall. #SuitDivas Ultimately, though, she enlisted the help of Ralph Lauren who generously loaned some of his vintage pieces to help bring the â€œSuited Upâ€ look to life on the big screen.

Putting my own spin on the trend for #FavoriteThings was fun and interesting because letâ€™s face it, this much material in South Florida is a novelty. Still, thereâ€™s nothing like shiny textures, bold prints and accessories thatâ€™ll turn heads. Whether you go boxy, baggy, fitted or total 80â€™s glam, getting â€œSuited Upâ€ is definitely this seasonâ€™s must-have trend and thatâ€™s why itâ€™s one of my Favorite Things. #ShakenNotStirred, please.

PS- I still own my first sassy red suit.

item.title: A Fashionable Cause
item.dc:creator: Johari Canty
item.description: What: Thrifting fall fashions at Dragonfly Boutique â€” â€œa LEAP initiative helping women empower their lives by putting prison in their past.â€ Why: God, I...
item.content:encoded:
What:

Thrifting fall fashions at Dragonfly Boutique â€” â€œa LEAP initiative helping women empower their lives by putting prison in their past.â€

Why:

God, I love the movie, â€œThe Shawshank Redemption,â€ and not because it glorifies prison life in that gritty Hollywood way. I love it because of its message of friendship, hope, love and ultimately, rehabilitation; which is the message of this weekâ€™s blog: â€œA Fashionable Causeâ€ (alongside thrifting some killer fall fashions.)

I stumbled across Dragonfly Thrift Boutique & Consignment Store on IG a few weeks ago and I was excited about it because I had just finished working with â€œThe House of Findingsâ€ â€” a beautiful store featuring glorious vintage and up-cycled clothing, accessories and decor in Upper Buena Vista. It was an enriching experience both personally & professionally, so I was hoping to keep that theme going for not just my readers, but for myself, too. #LuckyMe because…

Dragonfly is truly one-of-a-kind and not just because you can find couture labels, unspoken vintage, cool accessories, stylish shoes and incredible furnishings and decor there. Of course, thatâ€™s a major perk, but itâ€™s the storeâ€™s mission that makes it worth exploring on more than just a retail therapy kind of level.

100% of Dragonflyâ€™s proceeds go toward LEAP (Ladies Empowerment And Action Program,) a non-profit organization helping women find their footing after prison. They provide post-release jobs at the boutique, help with housing and most importantly, teach life skills. For most of us, education, income and a place to call our own equals #Security & #Empowerment

Not only can you shop for â€œA Fashionable Cause,â€ you can donate, too (new or gently used items,) or volunteer, become a mentor, employ a LEAP graduate, even host an event. There are so many ways to get involved. Another thing worth mentioning: thereâ€™s no other organization like LEAP in ALL of Florida; making it that much more important.

As far as the boutique itself, itâ€™s not even a year old and has already garnered enough buzz to be named â€œBest Thrift Store 2018â€ by Miami New Times â€” one look inside and youâ€™ll see why. Itâ€™s a fashionista’s playground and then some. When I told them about my fall fashion idea they pulled a rack of designer suits, velvety blazers and boho dresses to choose from.

Inspired by Versaceâ€™s 2000 fashion campaign â€œValley of the Dolls,â€ I piled on the boutique’s best accessories; earrings, bracelets, necklaces, scarves, purses and shoes. The bold and interesting furniture and decor (all for sale) served as the perfect photo backdrop. For me, fall fashion should be inspiring; filled with ample warmth and creative textures. The outfits chosen definitely expressed that.

In the meantime…

After the blog pictures were finished and my article filed, I went to dinner, alone, and spent a lot of time staring into the abyss thinking about what life after prison must be like. It was a traumatizing thought. I also wondered why the boutique chose the name Dragonfly, which I had failed to ask. After DMâ€™ing one of the lovely ladies involved with LEAP, she explained: â€œDragonflies symbolize transformation, adaptability and self-realization.â€ Of course, now it all made sense.

And, while â€œThe Shawshank Redemptionâ€ is just a movie, LEAP shares its ultimate message, but thankfully in real life â€” which is freedom without hope, purpose and community isnâ€™t freedom at all and thatâ€™s why â€œA Fashionable Causeâ€ is one of my Favorite Things.

item.title: Cups Oâ€™ Fun
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: Cheeky, sarcastic and really cool sayings I can finally get on board with â€” served with a side of morning coffee by #SheMugs. Oh,...
item.content:encoded:
What:
Cheeky, sarcastic and really cool sayings I can finally get on board with â€” served with a side of morning coffee by #SheMugs. Oh, and after 5pm, â€œCups Oâ€™ Funâ€ could be filled with something a little stronger. #JustSaying

Why:
I may look like a frilly girl with my love of fashion and all, but when it comes to my personality, Iâ€™m pretty much a straight shooter. As a journalist, I have to have thick skin and somewhat of a sarcastic sense of humor because letâ€™s face it, sometimes the world sucks and a good laugh can help you get through the BS of it all.

Thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m totally digging the new online coffee cup company, SheMugs. Theyâ€™ll slap anything on a #CupOfJoe and I do mean anything. Quirky sayings, pop culture quotes, even your deep-seated thoughts and believe you me, I have some pretty good ones or would that be bad ones?

The first time I read some of their mug logos on Instagram, I howled with laughter and found myself talking out loud to my phone saying things like: â€œExactly!â€ and â€œOh, hellzzz to the yezzzz.â€ SheMugs doesnâ€™t just say what youâ€™re thinking, they manage to come up with things you didnâ€™t even know you needed to say, but actually do. Lol. Does that make sense? The concept isnâ€™t just fun, itâ€™s refreshing. Especially in our â€œpost a positive saying or inspirational quoteâ€ social media society.

Speaking of, thereâ€™s nothing I hate more than one of those cheesy spiritual posts telling me to â€œLove Myselfâ€ or â€œBe the person nobody thought I could be.â€ Blah, blah, blah. Itâ€™s the fastest way for me to unfollow someone. I get it, you need it for yourself, but why do I have to hear what your therapist is telling you? Or what youâ€™re trying to extract from the universe yourself?

Iâ€™m all about positivity, but societal pressures are enough, I donâ€™t want to see it on my feed, too. I need a healthy dose of realism that can help me cope with oversleeping, stubbing a toe, breaking a nail; you know â€” life stuff. Emotional & spiritual exploration isnâ€™t going to help me meet my writing deadlines or get me through a 12-hour, non-stop day. For meâ€¦

SheMugs has those secret feel-good ingredients. It makes me laugh, it makes me smile; it takes the sting out of everyday life. It even gives new meaning to the simple pleasure of a great cup of coffee, tea, wine, sake, even vodka? Iâ€™m not judging. And, if you canâ€™t find what youâ€™re looking for, they customize personal sayings, mottos or, in my case, tagline: #ShireensFavoriteThings. The mugs themselves are great quality, too, or I wouldnâ€™t put my name on one.

In full disclosure, thereâ€™s another reason Iâ€™m crazy about these cups. The company was created by my good friend, Jessie Neft-Swinger, who also happens to be the Digital Editor of my blog. Sheâ€™s a computer guru, but sitting behind a desk all day was starting to zap her juju, so she came up with the idea of SheMugs and I have to tell you, I think itâ€™s bloody brilliant. Iâ€™ve known Jessie a long time and even watched her get married on a beautiful December day. I cried because seeing people happy and in love is incredibly special and so is â€œCups Oâ€™ Funâ€ and thatâ€™s why itâ€™s one of my Favorite Things. Cheers! (literally).

For more fashion photos visitÂ www.ShireenSandoval.com.

item.title: Dream Closet
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: Discovering Lakzya â€” a place where you can rent high-end couture to keep up with your glamorous lifestyle. And yes, youâ€™re gonna wanna post...
item.content:encoded:
What:
Discovering Lakzya â€” a place where you can rent high-end couture to keep up with your glamorous lifestyle. And yes, youâ€™re gonna wanna post that outfit.

Why:
I had a complete break-down last Monday while shooting my #ootd picture. It was hot out, my dress was too tight and I just felt bad about myself. I chalked it up to the beginning of the week, but I knew it was more than that.

Over the weekend, I had been sick in bed suffering a CIDP (Chronic Inflammatory Demyelinating Polyneuropathy) flare up. It loves rearing its ugly head when Iâ€™m stressed-out or if Iâ€™ve exercised too much. In this case, I had done BOTH, so now, I was paying the price.

Normally, a few days off from my busy life would be a nice respite, but nerve discomfort doesnâ€™t really work like that. You have to rest, take meds, but keep the mind busy, so youâ€™re not thinking about the pain. During my episodes, I spend a lot of time watching television, shopping online and of course, looking at social media. Ahhhh, social media. Itâ€™s a blessing and a curse. Last week, it was the latter.

IG was killing me â€” all those intriguing vacations, perfect romantic relationships, challenging work-outs, sculpted bodies, amazing parties and perfectly posed bloggers. I closed my eyes and wished the images away, but they penetrated my psyche. Eventually, I drifted off into an uncomfortable sleep of not feeling good enough.

A few days later, after my flare-up had passed, there I was, tugging at my dress, trying to smile for the camera in the blazing noon day sun. Even though I had sworn off social media a few short days ago (when I was feeling sick,) there I was trying to â€œKeep Up with the Jonesesâ€ or I guess, in this day and age, it would be more like the Kardashians? Perhaps, though, I was just trying to keep up with myself. Speaking ofâ€¦

My daily IG posts are to support my fashion & food blog, but over the years itâ€™s grown into showcasing what Iâ€™m wearing on Deco Drive, too. Hence my #ootd pictures, and thatâ€™s not all â€” whatever I wear (whether itâ€™s to a gala, cocktail party, work event, night on the town, vacation, brunch, lunch) itâ€™s usually planned out to be picture perfect. #SayCheese Itâ€™s not just part of my job, itâ€™s the modern-day way and while I do have a killer closet, more often than not, I find myself with NOTHING TO WEAR. #HowIsThatEvenPossible?

â€”Enter: LAKZYAâ€”

A boutique that specializes in giving fashionistas their â€œDream Closetâ€ by renting out a highly curated selection of designer dresses, gowns and coats. When I first heard about it, â€œRent the Runwayâ€ came to mind, of which Iâ€™ve never been a big fan. Itâ€™s not that I donâ€™t like the concept; itâ€™s because I need to see, feel, touch and have an experience with what I wear before I invest in it and #renttherunway is more of an online thing. I mean, they do have â€œsomeâ€ stores, but good luck finding one.

While Lakzya does have an online presence, their main approach is hands-on. You make an appointment and a stylist helps you find what youâ€™re looking for. My experience there was pretty amazing. I thought Iâ€™d find one, maybe two dresses to supplement my wardrobe demands but honestly, there were so many great things I actually had a hard time choosing. It wasnâ€™t just about the choices, either, it was the diversity of them. I tried a Stella McCartney Jumper, a Christian Dior dress originally designed by John Galliano, a Fendi Belted day-to-nighttime dress and a gorgeous Preen by Thornton Bregazzi red and pink number.

Need a bag to match? No problem. Lakzya has Chanel, Ferragamo, Ximena Kavalekas, Balenciaga and more. Everything in the store is in mint condition. Some have never been worn, worn once or theyâ€™ve been beautifully restored to their original state. The fashions at Lakzya didnâ€™t just make me happy, I giggled at the ease of it all. Forget â€œDream Closet,â€ itâ€™s more like a â€œDream Presentâ€ that never stops giving, with weekly wardrobe coming in and out youâ€™ll always find the BEST fashion has to offer.

What makes it even more appealing? The company was started by three incredibly chic women (Natalie, Anna and Valerie) who over the years, like most fashionistas, carefully invested in designer dresses and accessories, but after one wear that was it. With pictures, social media and intimate party circles, the beyond-expensive outfits would get pushed to the back of their closets where they lay in waiting for their next â€œpossibleâ€ wear and thatâ€™s when the idea of a â€œDream Closetâ€ was born. #SharingIsCaring

Lakzya easily restored my faith in finding the perfect outfit for any occasion, especially after months of muttering: â€œI have nothing to wearâ€ and Iâ€™m even feeling better (suck it, CIDP.) On that note, I realize social media is what you make it. Being interested and interesting online is how things roll these days, and finding healthy boundaries is important too, but first â€” let me post a picture of my â€œDream Closetâ€ outfit, because itâ€™s definitely one of my Favorite Things.

For more fashion photos visitÂ www.ShireenSandoval.com.

item.title: Music & Manicures
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: â€œGet Nailedâ€ at the hippest new salon in the Magic City. Why: When I first heard my good friend, Michelle Pooch, was opening a...
item.content:encoded:
What:
â€œGet Nailedâ€ at the hippest new salon in the Magic City.

Why:
When I first heard my good friend, Michelle Pooch, was opening a cool new business in Wynwood, I knew it was going to be special â€” because she is. Iâ€™ve known Michelle for years; in fact, when I first moved to Miami, she was one of my biggest cheerleaders, asking me to host charity events she was involved in or inviting me to fabulous parties she was promoting.

Back in the day, Michelle was always flanked by the rich and famous, but she was the one who stood out. So it didnâ€™t surprise me when I heard sheâ€™d been cast on VH1â€™s, â€œLove & Hip Hop: Miamiâ€â€” a reality show about all things Miami; mainly, its fabulous music scene. Her success, though, doesnâ€™t stop there. Michelleâ€™s just added #BossBabe to her already impressive resume.

Combining her world-renowned deejaying skills, party acumen and savvy television personality, sheâ€™s opened â€œGet Nailed Barâ€ â€” a full-service nail salon seamlessly mixing â€œMusic & Manicuresâ€ #SignMeUp! The funky little space, located in Wynwood, feels like New York City on the outside, but on the inside, it screams MIAMI. With glamorous artwork, a cocktail area, a â€œLove & Flip Flopâ€ bar & a cool little corner where Michelle can spin her tunes, youâ€™ll feel like youâ€™ve stumbled onto the best-kept secret in the city (at least, for now.) When I went last week to â€œGet Nailed,â€ I was completely enamored with my posh pampering experience.

~Translation~

Good-byeeeeee, elevator music and stank eye from your conservative nail neighbor (especially if youâ€™re on your iPhone) and HELLLoooo, energetic tunes, music videos and vixen-style nail art. From the manicure/pedicure menu you can choose from saucy services like The Mary J, The Mona or The Pippen Pedi. You can even customize with add-onâ€™s like The Britney Bitch (nail art), The Mariah (glitter application), The Cardi B (drippinâ€™ in dippinâ€™ powder) and so on. Thereâ€™s even a thousand dollar â€œQueen Bey â€” The Gold Record Edition,â€ featuring 24K exfoliation & nail polish. Believe you me, I thought about it, but the Deco Drive credit card doesnâ€™t have that kind of limit. Insteadâ€¦

The lovely, Annick (@glamdbyannick on IG, check her out, sheâ€™s amaze,) cleaned up my cuticles and carefully crafted my fingertips into complete fabulosity, all while sipping on a cocktail. (Me, not her. Lol. ) With help from Michelle, I decided on â€œThe Mary Jâ€ with a â€œTrina Rockstarâ€ add-on (which means custom crystals on my ring fingers.) After the digit-dust settled, I squealed like a school girl and Annick and I hit up social media to show off her artistry â€” fuzzy white hand prop and all.

Getting your nails â€œdidâ€ in the Magic City is easy; thereâ€™s practically a salon on every corner. But having an experience that energizes you and breathes new life into your beauty routine is something Michelle not only believes in, she does it for herself, too and now, I totally get why. â€œMusic & Manicuresâ€ doesnâ€™t just match my Miami lifestyle, it elevates my entire fashion game and thatâ€™s why itâ€™s one of my Favorite Things.

item.title: Treasure Hunting
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: Shopping for the unique and eclectic at â€œThe House of Findingsâ€ in Upper Buena Vista. Why: Magical, inspiring and one-of-a-kind: â€œThe House of Findingsâ€...
item.content:encoded:
What:
Shopping for the unique and eclectic at â€œThe House of Findingsâ€ in Upper Buena Vista.

Why:
Magical, inspiring and one-of-a-kind: â€œThe House of Findingsâ€ is just one of those special places. When I stumbled onto its social media profile about a month ago, I knew I had to see the chic new boutique in person AND the fashion Gods did not disappoint on this one. Itâ€™s simply, #HeavenOnRetailEarth …

Tucked inside the just opened â€œUpper Buena Vistaâ€ bohemian shopping community, â€œThe House of Findingsâ€ is an enchanting experience from the moment you see it and its whimsical windows are just a warm-up of whatâ€™s to come. From the magnificent to the marvelous, once inside, youâ€™ll find mint condition vintage clothing & accessories so unique, youâ€™ll hardly believe youâ€™ve found such treasures.

If I had my dream closet, â€œThe House of Findingsâ€ would definitely be my template. Itâ€™s warm lighting gives way to a cornucopia of well-placed nick-nacks, hats, broaches, sunglasses, purses, dresses, skirts, blouses and shoes, but itâ€™s the way itâ€™s all harmoniously presented thatâ€™s truly mesmerizing. Every square inch of the lovely little space evokes a need to explore, touch and discover.

Its irresistible quality didn’t happen by chance. In fact, itâ€™s a direct reflection of owner Mayra Gonzalez. Not only is she is a modern fashionista with a gypsy soul, her sweet smile and charming personality could disarm even the grumpiest Miami shopper. When I met her on a quiet Sunday morning, alongside her husband,
Dr. Biorn (whoâ€™s just as much a part of the business,) she happily explained how her travels and family life helped shape the character of her store.

Mayra, of course, has great style, but what makes her exceptional? Her fashion instincts: sheâ€™s able to see beyond herself and identify what others would like, look good in or what theyâ€™re truly â€œTreasure Huntingâ€ for. She styled me in bold and beautiful clothing and accessories. I donâ€™t want to sound dramatic, but Iâ€™m convinced sheâ€™s a mind reader.

The night before our blog collaboration, I was droning on to a close friend about breathing new life into my wardrobe. Working in TV News (albeit , entertainment) doesnâ€™t always give me the opportunity to express my true fashion individuality and I think Mayra got that about me. She chose pieces that said something, made a statement and let my true self shine through. If youâ€™re a regular blog reader, you know my take on fashion â€” itâ€™s not just an extension of your personality, itâ€™s a form of true artistic expression and looking for places to cultivate that can be difficult. Especially in this on-line, cookie-cutter, buy one. get one free shopping society weâ€™re living in. I want to see, engage, lament, emote and eventually, identify with what Iâ€™m buying.

Whether youâ€™re looking for something no one else will have or just longing for a quality boutique that puts people first, â€œTreasure Huntingâ€ at â€œThe House of Findingsâ€ is the perfect place to do it and thatâ€™s why itâ€™s one of my Favorite Things. Happy shopping, fashionistas!

item.title: Sole-ful Art
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: Beautiful hand-painted slide-onâ€™s for charity. Why: Iâ€™ve been trying to do this blog for about a year, and Iâ€™m not even exaggerating. ALEPEL approached...
item.content:encoded:
What:
Beautiful hand-painted slide-onâ€™s for charity.

Why:
Iâ€™ve been trying to do this blog for about a year, and Iâ€™m not even exaggerating. ALEPEL approached me months and months ago about its newest Capsule Collection; featuring beautiful one-of-a-kind hand-painted slide-onâ€™s, but then IRMA happened and my schedule fell apart and then LIFE happened and now, here we are.

Iâ€™ve always been a big believer that things happen in life as they should; when weâ€™re open and ready to receive them. Thatâ€™s how I feel about â€œSole-ful Artâ€. Iâ€™ve needed something “feel good” and meaningful, especially now.

Like a lot of people in our country, Iâ€™ve been in despair over some of our extreme and sometimes heartbreaking problems: mass shootings, political rhetoric and societal issues. Making matters worse? How weâ€™re treating one another.

Listen, I donâ€™t wanna open up a can of worms here. After all, this is a fashion blog AND over the years Iâ€™ve dedicated myself to making Favorite Things a safe harbor of feel-good stories & experiences, but my heart is heavy as I watch our country fuel its own vitriolic divide. Fighting for what you believe in is one thing, but disparaging others and becoming a mean-spirited tyrant is another.

When I open social media these days I literally wince, especially Facebook and Twitter. My friends, family, even journalists (who btw are supposed to be non-biased) spew opinionated hate. Is this really the world weâ€™re living in? Of course, I already know the answer. YES.

I donâ€™t expect us to all hold hands and sing “Kumbaya;” I know how the world works and it can be a cold, hard place. Iâ€™m talking about just common human decency. Love thy neighbor? Treat people the way you want to be treated? Is the Golden Rule dead or is she just taking a leave of absence? My gut instinct makes me shudder.

Then I remember something my parents taught me. One personâ€™s attitude, decorum and behavior CAN make a difference and thatâ€™s where â€œSole-ful Artâ€ comes in. ALEPEL by Adriana (a shoe company based on modern architecture and provocative design,) released their 2017 Capsule Collection to pay homage to Venezuela, the designers’ home country, but thatâ€™s not all. The company’s mission? Giving back.

Employing the talents of a young disabled Caribbean artist, ALEPEL released a line of joy-inspiring slides. The whimsical hand-painted themes centered around Venezuelaâ€™s national flower, bird and tree. Proceeds from the sale of the shoes went to a local non-profit organization in the region dedicated to helping abandoned children. The project was so successful, it extended into Breast Cancer Awareness Month.

Partnering with social media influencer, Angeles Almuna, ALEPEL released another one-of-a-kind, Capsule Collection celebrating the beauty and strength of women fighting breast cancer. These slide-onâ€™s featured delicate hand-painted peonies symbolizing good fortune, happiness and positivity for the future. A portion of the sales were given to GLAM4GOOD, an organization that ignites positive social change through style and fashion.

As â€œSole-ful Artâ€ has grown more popular, so has ALEPELâ€™s collaborations; most recently with on-line luxury retailer, Moda Operandi and one of my favorites, Olivela.com (when you shop on this site, they donate to children in need at no extra cost). When I finally received my own pair of slides a few weeks ago (mind you, almost a year later,) I was happy and emotional. Sure, I love shoes, but itâ€™s more than that â€” itâ€™s the gesture of good people in our community doing good things for those who need it.

And while there are a lot of things about the world that make me sad right now, there are also things like â€œSole-ful Artâ€ that give me hope and re-calibrate my purpose. Even if itâ€™s just one pair of shoes, itâ€™s certainly a step in the right direction â€” and thatâ€™s something every fashionista can wear well and thatâ€™s why itâ€™s one of my Favorite Things.

item.title: License to Frill
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: Getting to wear a one-of-a-kind, hand-painted couture gown in a setting that would make even James Bond jealous. The name is Sandoval, Shireen Sandoval....
item.content:encoded:
What:
Getting to wear a one-of-a-kind, hand-painted couture gown in a setting that would make even James Bond jealous. The name is Sandoval, Shireen Sandoval.

Why:
A few months ago, I got an email that rocked my fashion world. Mind you, with the hundreds I get on a daily basis it takes me days, sometimes weeks, to open them and even longer to respond. For whatever reason, this one was different. I clicked on it right away, scrolled down to the pictures and there it was â€” THE DRESS.

In a stroke of genius, TA Couture & Aston Martin Residences downtown Miami decided to join forces for a night of art & fashion and one of the impressive results? The gorgeous gown featured in â€œLicense to Frillâ€ â€” which is by far one of the most awe-inspiring things Iâ€™ve ever put on my body. Now I fully get the â€œfairy tale princessâ€ thing. #Swoon

The one-of-a-kind, eye-popping masterpiece was created by Fashion Designer Tammy Apostol (TA Couture) and hand-painted by artist Griselda Lechini. The princess-cut strapless gown features a full skirt with 60 yards of fabric & is embellished with crystals and silk flowers. The combination of impressionism artwork and ornate trimmings allows for a three-dimensional fashion experience. Adding an extra touch of elegance, fascinators from TA Coutureâ€™s millinery atelier.

So, where does Aston Martin Residences come into all this? Besides being a beautiful backdrop for the TA Couture event and â€œLicense to Frillâ€ â€” itâ€™s also awe-inspiring in its own way. Soon to be the tallest luxury condominium building in Miami-Dade, its extreme quality is married to its exceptional design and when you think about it, thatâ€™s exactly what couture embodies, too.

And, itâ€™s what Aston Martin prides itself on when designing cars like the Vulcan, which shares the spotlight in â€œLicense to Frillâ€ (shot inside the showroom at the Aston Martin residences.) With 820 horsepower and curves to make any man drool, the 2.3 million dollar hyper car isnâ€™t just engineering, itâ€™s art. There are only 24 in the entire world. Itâ€™s simply spectacular, but then again, what element of this blog isnâ€™t? #JackpotBlog

If youâ€™re not ready to jump into a ball gown, TA Couture also released a line of limited edition art tunics that incorporate Griseldaâ€™s paintings. Theyâ€™re perfect for a cocktail party, romantic dinner or just to add a burst of summer color to your wardrobe. By the way, if youâ€™re not familiar with TA Couture, you need to be. Especially if youâ€™re a glamour puss like myself. Tammy is an infectious and experienced designer whoâ€™s creations are expressive, chic and feminine.

Itâ€™s not everyday a girl gets a â€œLicense to Frillâ€ â€” but with the perfect combination of fashion, art, architecture and engineering, one canâ€™t help but get special permission to show it all off and thatâ€™s why itâ€™s one of my Favorite Things.

item.title: Summer Romance
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: Falling head over heels for Kendra Scottâ€™s 2018 Summer Collection, because who doesnâ€™t want to wear eye-popping statement jewelry, drenched in vibrant colors, that...
item.content:encoded:
What:
Falling head over heels for Kendra Scottâ€™s 2018 Summer Collection, because who doesnâ€™t want to wear eye-popping statement jewelry, drenched in vibrant colors, that leaves a lasting impression? Thatâ€™s not all: if you smell it, they will come or something like that…introducing Kendraâ€™s newest conquest: â€œThe Candle Collectionâ€.

Why:
I remember my first â€œSummer Romanceâ€ as if it were yesterday. It blossomed in a sleepy seaside town in North Carolina. The smell of the salty air, the feel of the sunburn on my fair skin and the taste of my boyfriends soft lips â€” it was all heavenly. We were both fourteen at the time and hopelessly in love.

That summer was one of the most special times of my life; wrapped in the warmth of a group of young friends, whose parents had bravely invited a dozen of us on an extended trip filled with endless days of laughter on the beach and lazy nights with planned putt-putt outings and picnic food to feed us. Once the house fell silent with sleep, my boyfriend and I would sneak outside and rendezvous on one the houseâ€™s large balconies.

We held hands under the stars, gazed into one anotherâ€™s eyes and let the gentle breeze of the ocean do the talking. When we felt comfortable enough, we kissed and kissed some more. It was innocent, pure and nothing about the weight of life had complicated it yet.

Looking back, not only do I remember the bright blue color of my boyfriendâ€™s eyes, but I recall the deep aqua-greens of the ocean, the vibrant textures of a summer well-lived and the smells of the sea, salt and sand. Even at a young age, it made me feel incredibly alive and present.

And now, thanks to Kendra Scottâ€™s 2018 Summer Jewelry Collection, those moments seem to be more than just a distant memory. The designer, whom Iâ€™ve always adored, has somehow managed to capture the essence of my â€œSummer Romanceâ€ with her unique and memorable new pieces.

Bathed in exotic colors and enhanced with something called Raffia (a paper-thin tropical texture,) Kendraâ€™s created fringe and tassel- centric necklaces, bracelets and to-die-for earrings. Her new baubles are brave, bold and have individual styling power. My favorites are the Kristen & Denise (both pictured in the blog.) When you wear a pair, you donâ€™t need any other accessory. #EarCandyAtItsFinest

And while Change isnâ€™t easy for any of us, Kendra does it with sophistication, sex appeal and the kind of â€œSummer Romanceâ€ you canâ€™t help but fall in love with. Her fashion-forward summer trends can literally transform any outfit. Speaking of transformations â€” using the power and healing energies of crystals and the rich & delightful smells of nature, Kendra is also introducing a new Candle Collection with three distinct creations.

The Rose Quartz, a stone of both the heart and unconditional love, smells of peony, vanilla & rose. The Amethyst, which can cleanse, calm and protect, has notes of blackberry, sandalwood & lilac blossom and Malachite, used for deep energy cleaning, is a fragrance of green ivy, frankincense & warm amber. The candles, which come with gorgeous crystals, are specifically designed to reflect different moods because as Kendra says: â€œSomedays I want to feel flirty, or even sultry. Others, I need a moment of calm and rejuvenation. But everyday I always choose optimism.â€

No matter what kind of mood Kendraâ€™s in these days, sheâ€™s channeling beautiful energy into some of the things I adore most: jewelry and home decor. Whether youâ€™re making a fashion statement or filling your home with the positive and powerful â€” a fabulous â€œSummer Romanceâ€ is always a great place to start and thatâ€™s why itâ€™s one of my Favorite Things. Happy Shopping!

item.title: A Day on Espanola Way
item.dc:creator: Sanah Faroke
item.description: Â What: Spending the day doing what I do best: shopping, eating, dancing, snoozing and exploring one of Miami Beach’s most iconic streets: Espanola Way. Why:...
item.content:encoded:
Â What:

Spending the day doing what I do best: shopping, eating, dancing, snoozing and exploring one of Miami Beach’s most iconic streets: Espanola Way.

Why:

â€œI canâ€™t think of a better way/ to spend the day/than on Espanola Way.â€ Especially after its massive multi-million dollar renovation. Sure, itâ€™s always been a popular thoroughfare and yes, itâ€™s always been inspiring, but now, its bustling personality is even bigger and better than before.

The secret ingredient? The street is FINALLY closed to cars, making it pedestrian-only. Now, you can easily stroll down the middle of the road like a boss, fully absorbing everything that makes Espanola Way so special â€” the enchanting Mediterranean architecture, lively restaurants, eclectic shops and secret nooks and passageways that lead to beautiful boutique hotels.

The area, originally formed as an artist colony back in the 1920â€™s, reminds me of my beloved Santa Fe and while itâ€™s not necessarily the Wild West, it does have an outspoken bohemian spirit mixed with a European flair I truly appreciate. Itâ€™s a place where everyone fits in â€” I emphasis this because Iâ€™ve noticed Miamiâ€™s recent penchant for pigeonholing people & places into categories: artsy, hipster, urban, nouveau riche; the list goes onâ€¦(for the record, I hate that and happen to live in an up-&-coming â€œseedyâ€ area). #Whatevezzzz

In full disclosure, for years Iâ€™ve avoided â€œA Day On Espanola Wayâ€ because of its touristy reputation but now, the area is flourishing with local activities: yoga classes, salsa nights and free monthly events open to the public. My day there was such an amazing experience. I felt transported to another city; another country even. After a leisurely morning of getting reacquainted with the area, I decided to have lunch, too.

Lucky for me, Havana 1957 was eager to host. The Cuban restaurant, which happens to be a South Florida staple, is not only a true reflection of one of Miamiâ€™s richest cultures, itâ€™s also a nod to Havana in its heyday and Iâ€™ll drink to that! Speaking ofâ€¦

Iâ€™m crazy about their large selection of mouthwatering mojitos. I tried the Strawberry & Classic, but they also have interesting ones like Red Bull & Diet, perfect for the partier who needs a pick-me-up or for those of us constantly watching our waistline. My favorite appetizer is â€œTostones Rellenos Havana 1957,â€ which are heartbreakingly good. You get an assortment of plantain cups stuffed with garlic shrimp, shredded roasted chicken, ropa vieja and ground beef. Sweet baby Jesus, these are #LIFEâ€¦

The Signature chicken, served with rice and plantains, is called Pollo Frita A La Cubana. Itâ€™s a crispy marinated half-chicken served in a yummy garlic and onion sauce. The pork is amazing, too. Lechon Asado, a slow roasted pork leg with Cuban mojo, is served with moro rice and yuca. If you prefer eating lighter, Havana 1957 also has a nice selection of salads, perfect for a hot summer day. I ended lunch with Guava Cheesecake. It was so good, I dreamed about it later that night. There I was, in a cloud of pillows eating that very dessert, taking gi-normous bites while trying to talk on live TV. LOL. Iâ€™m not sure what that was all aboutâ€¦

But I do know, rediscovering a place Iâ€™ve always loved is a magical feeling. Itâ€™s like reconnecting with an old friend, you know the inâ€™s & outâ€™s of the relationship, but years gone by have made them more textured, interesting and even better â€” thatâ€™s exactly how I feel about â€œA Day On Espanola Wayâ€ and thatâ€™s why itâ€™s one of My Favorite Things.

item.title: Frills & Flowers w/ Alice + Olivia
item.dc:creator: Steven Cejas
item.description: What: Celebrating spring fashions at alice + oliviaâ€™s gorgeous new flagship store in the Miami Design District. Why: Bold colors, flirty flowers and fancy...
item.content:encoded:
What:
Celebrating spring fashions at alice + oliviaâ€™s gorgeous new flagship store in the Miami Design District.

Why:
Bold colors, flirty flowers and fancy frills as far as the eye can see; itâ€™s everything I dreamed the new alice + olivia flagship store would be and then some. The chic new boutique, which held its official grand opening a few weeks ago on International Womenâ€™s Day, is a direct reflection of the wonderfully whimsical woman who started it all: Stacey Bendet.

Like any good idea, Stacey gave birth to alice + olivia quite naturally. As fashion legend has it, she was searching for the perfect pair of pants but came up empty. What started as an exciting trouser treasure hunt ended in a fruitless and frustrating fashion moment. However, the good news is a â€œFrills & Flowersâ€ seed was forever planted.

That was back in 2002 and apparently, Stacey was onto something because sixteen years later, her brand is a global sensation producing clothing, jewelry, shoes, purses and sunglasses. Her designs are eclectic, personality-driven and insanely unique, not to mention high-quality.

For spring, Stacey is using more than just flower power and incredible colors to engage fashionistas. Sheâ€™s added fun t-shirts with sayings like, â€œThe World Needs More Sparkleâ€ and â€œWhen Women Support Each Other Great Things Happen.â€ As you may have guessed, Stacey is all about empowering those around her and personally, thatâ€™s the kind of #ladyboss I want designing what I choose to put on my body. Speaking ofâ€¦

Staceyâ€™s new flagship store, in the heart of the Design District, is filled with the gorgeous and glamorous. The two-story ode to clean architecture and a decadent life style is enhanced by natural light with gi-normous floor-to-ceiling windows. Every corner of the place is well thought-out and creatively crafted. I especially love the dressing rooms; they make you feel and look good. I canâ€™t remember the last time I said that while getting my retail therapy on. From the wall paper to the carefully angled mirrors, youâ€™ll wanna take a few #selfies. I know I did.

So, why a flagship store in the Magic City? Because Stacey believes the women in Miami embody her brand: theyâ€™re sexy, stylish and not afraid to express themselves through fashion. Feeling special in your clothing is a beautiful thing, but finding a way to execute that “IT” factor without looking like everyone else around you is where alice + olivia owns the market and thatâ€™s why itâ€™s one of my Favorite Things.

item.title: Spring Fever
item.dc:creator: Johari Canty
item.description: What: Discovering & falling in love with Yara Bashoorâ€™s handbags and styling them with looks inspired by Springtime in South Florida. Why: If youâ€™re looking...
item.content:encoded:
What:
Discovering & falling in love with Yara Bashoorâ€™s handbags and styling them with looks inspired by Springtime in South Florida.

Why:
If youâ€™re looking for a new bag to beautify your Spring wardrobe, look no furtherâ€¦

Designer Yara Bashoor isnâ€™t just prettying up the Miami purse game with her gorgeous pieces; sheâ€™s also giving a girl on a fashion budget (that would be me) a chance to enjoy luxury for less. My 401k is rejoicing as I type this and Iâ€™m about to throw up an “amen” to the fashion gods â€” AMEN!

Using Alligator and South African Ostrich skins, she carefully curates bold, interesting and sophisticated clutches and totes. What I love most about her bags, besides the undeniable quality, is their decadent colors, textures and shapes.They remind me of that old-school board game, â€œCandy Landâ€ – bright and mood-lifting. Better yet, they trigger childhood memories of rainbow-colored snow cones ready to be devoured on a hot summer day.

Instead of sticky fingers, though, Yaraâ€™s purses feel more like butter: soft, supple and sinfully expensive. Usually a bag of this caliber would cost you a kidney or your first-born. Luckily, Yaraâ€™s ingenuity has led her to cut out the middleman, leaving costs solely wrapped up in craftsmanship and that, of course, benefits her customers.

Besides being entrenched in South Floridaâ€™s fashion community, where Yaraâ€™s purses are featured at local events and in the occasional local/luxury magazine, sheâ€™s gained true â€œSpring Feverâ€ footing on social media and by word-of-mouth, which is how I found her.

Thereâ€™s something else, too.

Yara is the kind of woman I straight-up admire. Sheâ€™s an architect, lawyer and designer (yes, in that order, but whoâ€™s keeping track when youâ€™re that successful.) I donâ€™t think itâ€™s a coincidence that her purses are a direct reflection of her chosen education and career path: structured lines, effortless durability and chic sophistication. Could she be any more fabulous?

While Yara describes her totes as â€œsmart, stylish and confident,â€ you canâ€™t help but notice sheâ€™s actually describing herself, and thatâ€™s why â€œSpring Feverâ€ is one of my Favorite Things.

item.title: Beauty at the Beach
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: Glamming it up on South Beach wearing Lexi Jewelry; a line inspired by nature, femininity and fashion. Why: I have a special place in...
item.content:encoded:
What:
Glamming it up on South Beach wearing Lexi Jewelry; a line inspired by nature, femininity and fashion.

Why:
I have a special place in my heart for Lexi Segre. Not only is she one of the first jewelry designers I featured on â€˜Favorite Thingsâ€™ when I first started the blog, but she also happens to be an incredibly talented artist who effortlessly captures the essence of â€˜life on the beachâ€™ with her beautiful baubles.

Itâ€™s not all hippy dippy, surfer girl either. Donâ€™t get me wrong, I love a good gypsy vibe, but I also need structure for my day job, which is TV Chic and sophistication for the city side of my personality. Lexi not only delivers that delicate diversity, she also inspires fashionistas to reach beyond seasonal trends and wear pieces that truly speak to them, hence the title of the blog: â€œBeauty at the Beach.â€ Meaningâ€¦

Iâ€™m not the kind of girl youâ€™ll necessarily find frolicking in the ocean â€” because working and living in Miami is an entirely different beast than vacationing here — but how I dress and the jewelry I wear IS a direct reflection of my surroundings: surf, sand, art deco buildings, a sparkling skyline and sexy people.

Using stones, shells, horns and bone, Lexi captures all of it with her one-of-a-kind pieces. While nature shapes and molds her creativity, the timeless elegance of the ancient Greeks and Romans — think Aphrodite mixed with Helen of Troy — gives her her true inspiration. What kind of fashionista doesnâ€™t want to serve up a little bit of earthy Greek goddess or some â€œBeauty at the Beachâ€ goodness? I know I do!

This year, as Iâ€™ve dedicated my blog to ALL things that truly make me happy, revisiting Lexi and her gorgeous line is something that feels like home. Maybe itâ€™s because the designer, whoâ€™s based in Miami, seamlessly blends everything that truly â€œspeaks to meâ€ and if that doesnâ€™t make you sparkle, I donâ€™t know what will and thatâ€™s why â€œBeauty and the Beachâ€ is one of my Favorite Things.

item.title: Scent of a Man
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: The intoxicating smell of love. Why: The first time I got a good whiff of my boyfriend, James, I knew it was true pheromone...
item.content:encoded:
What:
The intoxicating smell of love.

Why:
The first time I got a good whiff of my boyfriend, James, I knew it was true pheromone love. He was so intoxicating, I could hardly contain myself. In fact, I inappropriately sniffed him up at a cocktail party after one too many glasses of wine. He laughed it off, but I followed him around like a giddy school girl the entire night. It wasnâ€™t just his cologne; it was something stronger, something I couldnâ€™t quite put my finger on — or, in this case, my nose.

Months would pass before we saw each other again, and when we finally did, we were both going through rough break-ups. I canâ€™t speak for James, but the guy I was dating at the time had unceremoniously dumped me for being â€œtoo successfulâ€ and making him feel like â€œless of a man.” Strangely, I never liked the way he smelled anyway, which was a mix of pastrami, onions and dirty mop water. I know, I knowâ€¦

So why was I dating him in the first place? Well, after two failed marriages and a string of sucky boyfriends, I let someone at work (who happens to be editing this blog) talk me into taking a chance on someone I wouldnâ€™t normally date. I was game. I mean, why not? Growing up, my mom always used to say: â€œThe face of love will surprise you.â€

I donâ€™t think she meant FORCE YOURSELF TO LIKE SOMEONE, but I was desperate and slightly immature. Itâ€™s not that I didnâ€™t like him; it just never really clicked. He knew it, and I knew it. So he put â€œUSâ€ out of our misery. I took it pretty hard, but honestly, it was about more than just the break-up, it was ALL of it.

I thought Iâ€™d never find true love or any love, for that matter. I was so good at making bad decisions, I made Flava Flavâ€™s obnoxious dating show â€œFlavor of Loveâ€ look like a romantic Hollywood classic.

Anyhow, a few days after we parted ways, I became extremely depressed and despondent. I spent hours over-analyzing my life, drinking too much and drunk texting another ex-boyfriend. My inadequate feelings led to a brief reunion. Boy, oh boy, was THAT a mistake. As if he wasnâ€™t crazy enough the first time, on our second go around he gave Charles Manson a run for his money. He didnâ€™t murder anyone, but he was a spitting image of the serial killer and did I mention crazy? #WeAllMakeMistakes #SometimesTwice

After that, I gave up on men altogether and did something out of the ordinary. I followed my nose…

When I first called James, it was purely innocent. I had no idea he was going through a break-up and/or how heâ€™d respond to me ringing him up out of the blue asking for relationship advice. He was cordial and generous with his time and told me if any man felt threatened by my success that was on them and had nothing to do with me.

Our conversations spilled into emails and then text messages and eventually into a few get-togethers with mutual friends. Along the way, I noticed that James did things that no other man in my life had ever done. He called when he said he would, he texted without fail, he didnâ€™t play games and he never, ever magically fell off the face of the earth. My ex-husband was astonishingly good at that last one.

James was stable, reliable and acted like he genuinely wanted to be around me, but what about taking it to the next level? Was I misreading him? I didnâ€™t have the confidence to ask him in person, so I decided to text him instead…

Me: You know I really like you, right?
James: I like you, too.
Me: No, I mean I like you, LIKE you.
(Silence)
Me: I want to be more than just friends.
(Silence)
James: I feel the same.

Those four little words would change my life BIG time. After that text exchange, James has never stopped loving me (through the good and the bad.) During our first few months together as a couple, I stumbled around in a haze of love. I was completely ridiculous, ask me if I cared? NOPE.

When James left for work, Iâ€™d sniff the pillows he slept on or the shirts he left behind. When heâ€™d go out of town, Iâ€™d wear his clothes around the house and squirt myself with his cologne. Eventually, I confessed my â€œScent of a Manâ€ obsession to which James replied: â€œI kind of figured that out the night of the cocktail party.â€ Was I embarrassed? NOPE.

Thatâ€™s the thing about the right kind of love: it gives you the confidence to be yourself. In my other relationships, I was always jockeying for position; trying to figure out exactly what was happening and where I stood. Not with James, though: itâ€™s clear, straightforward, undeniable love and attention. That doesnâ€™t mean itâ€™s always easy, but it means itâ€™s ALL worth it.

Four years later and Iâ€™m still sniffing my way around the relationship. The only difference now is James and I have a life together, we have history and a more mature love – still – whether Iâ€™m smelling his shirt, pillows or his delicious neck: â€œScent of a Manâ€ will always be one of my Favorite Things. Happy Valentines Day!

FB: @ShireenSandoval
Twitter: @ShireenSandoval

For more fashion photos visit www.ShireenSandoval.com

â€œThe best smell in the world is the man that you love.â€ â€” Jennifer Aniston

item.title: The Ultimate Traveling Companion
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: If I collected all of my special travel memories & awe-inspiring moments on the road and put them into one place, it would look...
item.content:encoded:
What:
If I collected all of my special travel memories & awe-inspiring moments on the road and put them into one place, it would look and feel like a Boucle Bag.

Why:
When I caught my very first glimpse of a Boucle Bag, I was completely intoxicated by its originality. Yes, it actually made me HAPPY, something I talked a lot about in my first blog of the year: â€œA Fashionable Change.”

Purses donâ€™t usually evoke emotion out of me; I mean, Iâ€™m a shoe girl, but this one? WOW. With its bold colors, yummy textures and individual styling, I could hardly ignore HOW it made me feel.

Boucle Bags arenâ€™t just purses, theyâ€™re travel bags inspired by the Far East and one of the area’s creative customs: people write wishes on colorful tags and tie them around tree branches. Whether itâ€™s love, health, success or happiness, those hopes and dreams are sent into the universe, leaving a kaleidoscope of fascination behind.

Not only does Boucle bring that beautiful tradition to life via fashion, it does it with exquisitely handcrafted quality. No two bags are alike and all that gobsmacking detail isnâ€™t just reserved for the outside. Boucle Bags are roomy, sturdy and ready to help you chicly conquer your next destination: work, play, a long weekend getaway or how about that trip youâ€™ve always dreamed of?

Speaking ofâ€¦

I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve ever been able to truly express the impact traveling the world has had on my heart. My first golden sunset in Australia, the incredible visual impact of Hong Kongâ€™s cityscape, the lush green rolling hills of Scotland and the rich architecture and opulence of Russia. I canâ€™t wait for my next exciting adventure and you can bet my new Boucle Bag will be right there with me and thatâ€™s why â€œThe Ultimate Traveling Companionâ€ is one of my Favorite Things.

item.title: A Fashionable Change
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: A day at the beach with Solea Cangas and figuring out what I really want Shireenâ€™s Favorite Things to be. Why: You may not...
item.content:encoded:
What:
A day at the beach with Solea Cangas and figuring out what I really want Shireenâ€™s Favorite Things to be.

Why:
You may not know this, but when I first started the blog it was a way for me to express the pain and hurt of some devastating things that happened in my life: the loss of a baby, a major illness and the break-up of my marriage. It was some heavy stuff and I wasnâ€™t exactly parading around South Florida in stylish trends. I was just trying to keep my head above water. Actually, if Iâ€™m being totally honest, I was a complete disaster. The writing/blogging helped with my grieving process and sharing my stories eventually healed me. At least to the point where I felt I was OKAY…

After the s*** storm hit. Because frankly, thereâ€™s no other to describe itâ€¦

The blog took on a more â€œstylishâ€ turn. I felt guilty about it for awhile, mainly because my more serious storytelling had developed a strong online following. Taking a lighter, less â€œimportantâ€ direction felt like a complete sell-out. It wasnâ€™t, though; I promise you. Instead, it was a way of giving myself permission to leave my deep sadness and the morose introspection that always followed it behind.

When I first started the blog as it’s known now: â€œShireenâ€™s Favorite Thingsâ€â€¦

I got A LOT of push back. Career-based fashion bloggers turned up their noses at me, my television co-horts didnâ€™t understand it and key people around me (who pretended to care) just wanted to capitalize on it. Whatâ€™s more, some readers didnâ€™t want the “happy” me; perhaps the “sad” me was more relatable. In the meantime, all I wanted to do was write, tell stories, find creativity, inspiration and hopefully give birth to the new person I wanted, needed and hoped I could be.

The first year of â€˜Favorite Thingsâ€™ (everyone involved) worked like gangbusters. We gave up everything â€” especially our free time. It was hard at first, but we grew accustomed to it, then we got better at it and learned not to sacrifice what everyone needed: a break (even fashion has seasons for a reason.) As the years passed and the blog grew in popularity, Deco Drive got involved and WSVN supported my stylish storytelling like a proud mother, giving me creative liberties, cheering on my original content and awarding me an on-air fashion segment to run in tandem with the online blog.

Since thenâ€¦

Iâ€™ve tackled almost every topic: movies, celebrities, famous and local fashion designers, seasonal, solo and eccentric trends, boutiques, interesting South Florida places and eventually, food (which happens to be an incredibly popular part of the blog now called: Shireenâ€™s Spotlight.)

During the thick of it, Iâ€™d always ask myself: Do people care? Are they reading? Are they clicking onto something thatâ€™s enriching their lives? Is it enriching mine? And â€” whatâ€™s the ultimate outcome?â€ I didnâ€™t know the answers beyond what the analytics were telling me. What I did know was…

When I pressed those closest to me (like my own mother,) most hadnâ€™t even read the blog; including people who were working on it. â€œI havenâ€™t read it, but I do love the pictures,â€ was the typical response Iâ€™d get. Still, I pushed on.

Iâ€™m not stupid. I mean, I get weâ€™re living in a phone-driven, photo-taking, time-pressed society. Easy immediacy is the name of the game. Plus, Iâ€™m at THAT age â€” the one where you do things for yourself and not other people. Writing, blogging, exploring, reporting, traveling, working weekends, eating a lot of food..I did it for myself and itâ€™s been enough â€” until now.

Over the holidays, I took a long break from blogging. I needed it because I felt tired and uninspired and it was gnawing at me. WHY? Why had something I loved so much changed? Most of us hate change and Iâ€™m one of those people. I like a good challenge, but when feelings and emotions start twisting and turning inside me, I panic because I know itâ€™s time to re-evaluate and get real with myself.

At first, though, I ignore it for as long as humanly possible, but eventually, it spills over into everything I say and do, followed by long bouts of anxiety, crying jags and unhappiness. Itâ€™s almost as if my inside emotions are forcing me to change my outward path and begrudgingly, I HAVE to do it.

So, here we are â€” at the edge of the cliff of change â€” about to jump (and thank you if youâ€™re actually reading this and not just looking at the pictures, especially Matty, because he has to and Jackie, because sheâ€™s my biggest cheerleader.)

From now on, Iâ€™ll be featuring things on the blog that evoke a special kind of emotion out of me: mainly, HAPPINESS. Like the very thing highlighted today â€” soleacangas.com â€” a company inspired by the ocean, uplifted by art and started by strong, entrepreneurial women. Itâ€™s a wrap-slash-beach blanket, with yummy lightweight material. The idea hails from the beaches of Rio, one of my favorite places on earth.

As I continue reinventing myself and Favorite Things…

I want more simplicity, as in less explaining. Yes, Iâ€™m caving, while a lot of people donâ€™t have time to sit down and read, imagine what itâ€™s like finding time to write pages upon pages of heartfelt fashion stories (especially with another full-time uber-demanding job.)

Not everything I focus on from here-on-out will be featured on TV. Not only can an aggressive deadline squash my creativity, but it takes away from the original â€œje ne sais quoiâ€ of the blog.

I hope my new direction leaves you feeling good, inspired and yes, even happy after checking out the blog. Itâ€™s the least I can do for my faithful followers because YOU are one of my Favorite Things.

For more fashion pictures visit www.ShireenSandoval.com

Be Social

soleacangas.com

â€œThe only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move into it, and join the dance.â€ â€” Alan W. Watts

item.title: Slay in Herve
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: Slay in Herve â€¦ because itâ€™s the best way to end a fashionable year What: Wrapping up 2017 wearing one of my Favorite Things: HERVE...
item.content:encoded:
Slay in Herve â€¦ because itâ€™s the best way to end a fashionable year

What:
Wrapping up 2017 wearing one of my Favorite Things: HERVE LEGER. Plus, a little jibber-jabber about hopes, dreams and fancy things in 2018.

Why:
Ahh, romance & glamour…

Nothing used to say â€œNew Year’s Eveâ€ to me like a fabulous dress, a festive party and a fantastic man.

Think the popular 80â€™s movie: â€œWhen Harry Met Sally.”

More specifically, that famous last scene in the film when Harry & Sally realize theyâ€™re freaking nuts about each other.

It starts out with a hurried Harry pushing his way through a crowded New Year’s Eve party trying to find a heartbroken Sally. Heâ€™s in street clothes, she, of course, is in a gorgeous off-the-shoulder dark blue cocktail dress, looking every inch the fashion goddess.

Despite being broken up for months, the â€œmeant to be” couple finally comes face-to-face on one of the most iconic nights of the year.

And, while their chemistry is ELECTRIC and their love PALPABLE, their happily-ever-after hangs delicately in the balance (Get me a tissue!).

Then…

Harry proceeds to tell Sally sheâ€™s the person he wants to spend the rest of his life with. He adds sweetly: â€œI love you.â€ â€œWhat?â€ She says perplexed. â€œI love you,â€ he says emphatically.

Sally doesnâ€™t believe Harry (because, well, most of the time men suck,) so she explains: â€œIt doesnâ€™t work that way! You canâ€™t just barge back into my life expecting to pick up where we left off, because itâ€™s New Year’s Eve and you feel lonely.â€

Just as the traditional countdown begins, Harry tells Sally he doesnâ€™t love her because heâ€™s lonely, he loves her because of her special idiosyncrasies; like how she gets cold when itâ€™s 71 degrees, how her face wrinkles up just above her nose when he says something annoying and how it takes Sally an hour or so just to order a simple sandwich.

“Auld Lang Syne” starts playing in the background and Sally cries: â€œI hate you, Harry,â€ but of course, she doesnâ€™t really hate him, she LOVES him, they love one another. As they embrace and fall into a passionate kiss, the camera zooms out revealing the landscape of the party: the balloons, the confetti and dozens of couples dancingâ€¦ Happy New Year!!

OMG! Be still, my besotted heart.

Not only is that scene major movie magic, itâ€™s something Iâ€™ve tried recreating for the better part of my adult life. The dress, the party, the man, the romance of it all and the trappings I assumed came along with it.

LUCKILY, somewhere along the way, life grabbed me by the shoulders and shook the hopeless romantic out of me. I know, I know, it sounds kind of morose, but actually, it was more like divine intervention.

Hollywood happiness isnâ€™t just fleeting, itâ€™s not even humanly possible. In fact, itâ€™s a fool’s set-up for complete and utter disappointment. And while Iâ€™m at it, so is all the â€œpolitically correctâ€ love rhetoric floating around in todayâ€™s society.

I donâ€™t like ad campaigns, movies, social media, fairytales, religion, race or even my parents telling me how to love, who to love and what I should be wearing while Iâ€™m doing it.

You see, I tried all that on for size and it didnâ€™t fit. In fact, it was suffocatingly small for what life really had in store for me. Two divorces and a lot of emotional baggage later…

I realized…

Life is ridiculously messy and heartbreaking and more often than not, it doesnâ€™t come with witty Billy Crystal dialogue, good movie lighting and a perfect wardrobe (believe me, some of my early New Yearâ€™s Eve outfits were real doozies.)

Eventually, that dress, that man, that party, it all changes. The focus appropriately shifts to the woman youâ€™re becoming, how the man treats you (with loving actions, not gilded words) and just as important, itâ€™s about who you choose to surround yourself with (even when at a party.) We are, after all, the company we keep.

As New Years pass, Iâ€™ve had a lot of time to think about â€œWhen Harry Met Sallyâ€ and exactly what I was trying to extract from the last scene of the movie. And…

The answer is still somewhat elusive because itâ€™s not necessarily tangible. Instead, itâ€™s this incredible *feeling* that washes over me when I watch it. One of warmth, hope, dreams and desires…

Which is impossible to find during an hour and thirty six minutes of cinematic romance. It simply takes a lifetime of mistakes: highs, lows, self-tolerance, growth and trusting yourself to find out exactly WHAT it is that YOU need and what YOU want and no one else.

And while I still love a fabulous dress, a festive party and a fantastic man, Iâ€™ve learned to go about it the right way â€” MY WAY â€” because we all deserve our own #HappilyEverAfter even if itâ€™s not something Hollywood would ever write about and thatâ€™s why â€œSlay in Herveâ€ is one of my Favorite Things.

A special thank you to BCBG South Beach & Herve Leger for supporting my ambitious fashion writing and television career everyday of the year.

This blog is dedicated to Jackie Kay.

Where:

Lincoln Road Mall
Miami, Florida 33139
(On the corner of Lincoln and Meridian.)

When:
Monday-Wednesday: 10 a.m. – 10 p.m.
Thursday-Saturday: 10 a.m.Â  – 12 a.m.
Sunday: 11 a.m. – 11 p.m.

www.herveleger.com & www.bcbg.com

â€œIsnâ€™t it funny how day by day nothing changes, but when you look back everything is differentâ€¦â€ â€” C.S. Lewis

item.title: Topping It Off for 2018!
item.dc:creator: Hans Morgenstern
item.description: What: Making my New Year’s Eve outfit extra-special with some magnificent millinery AND trying to breath new life into my usual â€œAuld Lang Syneâ€ traditions....
item.content:encoded:
What:
Making my New Year’s Eve outfit extra-special with some magnificent millinery AND trying to breath new life into my usual â€œAuld Lang Syneâ€ traditions.

Why:
GANGBUSTERS!

Thatâ€™s how Iâ€™d describe my typical New Yearâ€™s Eve. At least over the past decade, but itâ€™s probably not what youâ€™re thinking. Especially if youâ€™re taking GANGBUSTERS positively. Sure, yes, itâ€™s a success, but barely.

My night usually goes something like this…

After hosting Deco Drive, I jump OFF the set and INTO a Channel 7 live truck, where Iâ€™m whisked away to the biggest party in Miami. I know, I know, it sounds kind of glamorous, but itâ€™s sooooo NOT. At some point during our hurried drive, we hit cra-cra traffic and thatâ€™s when the nail-biting nightmare begins.

My heart races, my palms sweat and my mind goes through a million trouble-shooting scenarios. Not because Iâ€™m nervous to be on TV; itâ€™s about what goes along with it…

Getting timely interviews, writing a comprehensive story about the night’s revelries and dealing with the boozers â€” who love giving mom a shout-out or yelling obscenities at me â€” while Iâ€™m on live TV (donâ€™t be THAT person ).

Even worse, the journalism part has to happen BEFORE 10 oâ€™clock.

Okay, okay, so I know what youâ€™re thinking: if I get off the set at 8pm (when Decoâ€™s over) and head to the party, it seems do-able. Challenging, but do-able.

The problem? Traffic, crowd congestion, DUI checks, finding the other crew who are set up and waiting for me. Tick tock, tick tockâ€¦

One year, I landed in front of the camera ONE minute before I was supposed to be on. My story wasnâ€™t done and I was panting from running a few blocks to get to my crew (obviously before my bad knee situation. Although, honestly, when it comes to live TV, you run despite a bad knee).

It was a disaster, but itâ€™s live television and the show must go on. In fact, it always goes on, with or without you. I had some props (squeaky toys and some confetti) so I made due and for my next live-shot was able to string together something resembling a story.

Thenâ€¦

Around 11:30 p.m., the news ENDS and the crew packs up (we call it break down) and weâ€™re left deciding exactly â€œwhatâ€ to do.

If Iâ€™m working with a photographer who has a family or significant other, usually he or she is motivated to make it home before the New Year countdown, but more often than not, we find ourselves stuck in traffic or just not physically able to wiggle our way out of the situation weâ€™re already in.

And just like that, sitting in a nondescript news vehicle somewhere alongside I-95 or Biscayne Boulevard, the clock unceremoniously turns midnight. Uh, Happy New Year?

Listen, Iâ€™m not belly-aching (okay, maybe I am just a little,) itâ€™s what I signed up for. You know, the whole journalist thing. You move away from home, work on holidayâ€™s, early in the morning, late at night, on weekends, you travel more than a 747 and sometimes, you spend New Years Eve at the last place in the world you wanna be. Iâ€™ve made my peace with it so donâ€™t feel sorry for me.

The good news is…

As I get older and have more seniority, I get SOME holidays off, but man, I always have wicked bad luck with New Years Eve. Last year, I actually spent it on a plane. Donâ€™t ask. I tried doing a silent NYE countdown in my head, but the guy next to me was so busy telling me about his new rap video and how I should put it on Deco Drive, I couldnâ€™t concentrate. Uh, Happy New Year?

This year, thoughâ€¦

The holiday falls on the weekend AND I happen to be OFF or at least my bosses havenâ€™t told me Iâ€™m working (yet) and Iâ€™m not about to ask (donâ€™t worry, they donâ€™t read my blog. Hi, Tom! Hi, Geoff!)

In celebration, Iâ€™ve been planning like a mad â€œhatter.â€

Caviar for everyone! Send a case of champagne to the station and donâ€™t forget that all-important outfit so you can â€œParty Like Itâ€™s 1999â€ or in this case, 2018.

Am I over-doing it? Well, maybe the Caviar and champagne part, but as far as what Iâ€™m wearing? Iâ€™ll be â€œTopping It Off for 2018â€ becauseâ€¦

I want more than just a dress, more than just sparkly earrings, I want pizzaz, originality and of course, a special night off! Thatâ€™s why I enlisted the help of Featherheart Designs by Dannielle Kukar; a skilled milliner, who knows how to take fashion to the next level with her fancy fascinators and sophisticated hats.

When I ask her why a woman should â€œTop It Off for 2018,â€ she coyly says: â€œIt gives an outfit that special oomph; besides, you never forget a person in a hat.â€ And, I totally agree and believe you me, I donâ€™t like fuss. I like ease and elegance and thatâ€™s exactly what her creations are. They slip on just as easy as they slip off. (BTW, You place a fascinator and you wear a hat.)

Dannielle, whoâ€™s a trained graphic artist, understands shapes, lines and composition. She started making fascinators as an outlet to get away from her computer. Now, if you dream it, she custom makes it. â€œI just follow the muse,â€ she says and she does so with the highest quality silks and materials. She also has pieces â€œready to wear.â€

This New Year’s Eve, Iâ€™m also dreaming of a sultry atmosphere with an Art Deco flair like the National Hotel (pictured in the blog.) Iâ€™m reminiscing, laughing and singing a new kind of â€œAuld Lang Syneâ€ â€” one thatâ€™s far away from the time crunch of live television.

Even, if, for just one nightâ€¦

Donâ€™t miss Deco Drive at 7:30 & 11:30 p.m. as we â€œTop It Off for 2018â€ with Featherheart Designs by Dannielle. From how to wear a fascinator to fabulous hat trends, weâ€™re showing off gorgeously glamorous headgear, because a fashionable and Happy New Year is one of my Favorite Things. Cheers!
